ygData.subject: Re: Getting our Concerns Noticed
ygData.msgSnippet: I must say that a massive Feedback campaign is not the way to go. I would try to email Verant with a well written letter, and cross post it to the message
ygData.messageBody:
I must say that a massive Feedback campaign is not the way to go. I would try
to email Verant with a well written letter, and cross post it to the message
boards as well as the major web pages. If all this doesn't work, it would be
understandable if you went to greater length to be heard.


However, I don't think there are any issues to be raised. I fully comprehended
when it told me my character would be Hard to play, and that is half the
challenge of it. Sure it is a pain in the arse, but until you start to enjoy
your character for what it is and what it can do, you will never enjoy EQ. It
is pointless compareing yourself to other characters and wishing you had what
they had. To be perfectely honest, I beleive I have no equal in combat at my
level other then another SK, and i am only lvl 14. I have had this belief
since I was level 8 and beat the crap out of a lvl 9 monk. I still beleive I
can do the same against every other class.

Inos



erik lawrence antonsen wrote:

> From: erik lawrence antonsen <eantonse@...>
>
> Well, it sounds like people are interested in trying something. We need
> to:
>
> 1. Come up with a couple common things that we want addressed.
>
> 2. Have 1 day where everyone gets on and /feedbacks them either the
> same statement or a statement containing identical issues.
>
> So how many people are on this list? How many are willing to participate?
> And when do we want to do it?
>
> Oogog
>
